text: tava pade nati āmi kori bāro bāro
translation: O Holy Name! Your glories are boundless! Therefore I bow down at Your lotus feet again and again.
O grand festival of Gokula! O ocean of bliss! I fall down at Your lotus feet, for I am feeling very distressed and troubled at heart.

text: tava pade poḍi tava guṇa kori gāna
translation: You are Lord Krishna, Your divine form is fully perfect and complete, and You are the origin of all transcendental mellows. Falling down at Your lotus feet, I sing of Your divine qualities.

text: je kore tomār pade ekānta āśroya
translation: You definitely destroy the multitude of afflictions of that person who takes exclusive shelter at Your holy feet.

text: sarva aparādha tumi nāśa kara tā’ra
translation: You destroy all of their offences, even to the extent of the nāma-aparādhas (the ten offenses against the chanting of the Holy Name).
Cleansing them of all impurities, You are then seated upon the throne of their heart as their supreme shelter.

text: ‘raso vai saḥ’ boli’ veda kore tuyā gān
translation: You are delightful and beautiful, the personification of complete cognizance and condensed bliss. The Vedas sing of You, saying, “The Supreme Personality of Godhead is verily the personification of all transcendental mellows.”
At the lotus feet of Śrīla Rūpa Goswāmī, Bhakti Vinod constantly begs at every moment for the direct revelation of the Holy Name.
